intro: Buchnera forbesii, commonly known as the Forbes' buchnera, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel species. The plant is characterized by its delicate, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Buchnera forbesii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
